title: Intentional Systematic Instructional Design for Graduate Research Mentoring

context.prior_knowledge: Undergraduate-level research methodologies and basic language domain knowledge
context.additional_context: Instructional design systematically analyzing power dynamics, communication practices, and knowledge production processes in research mentoring for prospective language graduate students

learning_goals: Learners can classify three or more types of student-advisor interactions in the research mentoring process and apply them contextually
Learners can establish a step-by-step mentoring plan from research topic selection to final report writing using intentional systematic pedagogy
Learners can develop simulated mentoring scenarios reflecting research ethics, power dynamics, and communication issues to respond to real-world situations

resources: LMS Platform (Video Conferencing, Discussion Board, Assignment Submission Features)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
